column1: full, wide of off, and driven past cover. Confident start for Shadman
length, wide outside off again, and he leaves. Goes through quite low to da Silva behind the wicket, at 128 kph
comes closer to the stumps to release this. Length, around off, and defended towards cover-point

straighter, angles in to him, and he is able to work it away towards fine leg. Roach throws his hands up in the air. Knows he had almost done enough to get Shadman trapped in front, but there's just no pace on this wicket to work with
back of a length, a bit of shape away, and he defends to third slip, along the ground
full toss, driven to mid-off
starts with a full toss down the leg side, too far away from Shadman to flick
too full outside off, jams his bat at it to dig it out on the leg side
Gabriel is yet to get his length right. Serves another juicy full toss on the leg stump, this time Shadman flicks it through midwicket for four
short of length this time, rising towards the rib cage, Shadman gets on his toes and defends it down
similar line and length, short and rising towards the batsman. Shadman hops and dabs it behind square leg
short of length on the leg stump but doesn't rise as much as the last two deliveries, tucked away towards square leg for a couple
fuller around off, hardly any pace off the surface. Tamim comes forward and blocks
length ball, in the channel. Tamim ends up defending inside the line and gets beaten
fuller and wider and Tamim creams it through the cover region, both openers off the mark with boundaries
length ball around off, comes forward and defends it on the leg side
fuller around off, blocked again from the front foot
length ball around off, comes forward and defends again
fuller on the pads, clipped away towards fine leg
fuller on the pads and glanced fine, Tamim gets another boundary. Easy pickings these
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball angling in, turned away towards short leg
fuller on the stumps, flicked in front of square leg. There's a fielder at deep square leg. With that single, Tamim has gone past Mushfiqur Rahim as the most run-getter for Bangladesh
fuller around off, Shadman presents the full face and pushes it gently past mid-off. Gets a couple
length ball around, comes forward and blocks
a sharp bouncer this time, Tamim had no problem ducking under it

chopped on. Roach provides the first breakthrough. Was a length ball that kept coming in with the angle. Tamim was forward but not to the pitch of the ball and it sneaked between bat and pad, brushing the flap of the pad before hitting the stumps
short of length outside off, sways away and leaves it alone. Bounces before the keeper
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length around off, blocked again
a sharp bouncer angling across the batsman, Shadman does well to drop his hands in time
short again to get the batsman hopping, dabbed down on the leg side
short of length angling away, left alone by Shadman
short again, this time well away from the batsman, left alone
extra bounce from short of length, surprises Shadman who takes the bottom hand off. The ball hits the handle of the bat
short of length at the batsman, stays back and drops it down at his feet
fuller and wider outside off, driven past the diving mid-off on his right. And guess what, Shanto is also off the mark with a boundary
length ball around off, defended from the front foot
length ball angling in, Shanto is right behind it and blocks
length ball, a bit wider outside off this time, a big stride forward to keep it out
length ball around off, defended down the wicket
fuller outside off, pushes it towards extra cover
short of length but the line is once again down the leg side, tucked away towards fine leg
fuller but way down the leg side, Shanto cannot connect the flick
length ball on the pads, tucked away in front of square leg
fuller around middle and leg, looks to defend but gets a thick outside edge that dribbles towards gully
that's the line West Indies want Gabriel to bowl. Short of length, just leaving the batsman. Shadman was stuck in his crease, looks to defend and gets beaten
fuller on the stumps, works it towards short midwicket
and beats the bat with his first ball. Was a length ball, a bit of sharp turn as Shanto was looking to defend
length ball around off, defended
a thick outside edge this time as Shanto looked to work it on the leg side. Goes past the first slip
fuller outside off, pushed towards covers
tossed up outside off, punched towards extra cover
length ball at the stumps, defended from the front foot
a low full toss down the leg side, not within Shanto's reach as he tries to get some bat on it
another half-volley, just around off, driven between the bowler and mid-off for four
much better this time, length ball around middle and off, defended down the ground from the front foot
short of length but way outside off, Shanto ignores it
short of length around off, gets on his toes and defends it on the off side
beaten. A length ball in the channel. Shanto pushes at it and misses
fuller on the stumps, digs it out back towards the bowler
pitched up on the stumps, whipped past the mid-off fielder this time. Got to the pitch of the ball and hit it against the turn
Cornwall pulls back his length. Defended on the front foot
length ball around off, comes forward to defend. The ball hits the outer half and rolls on the off side
length around off, defended with a good stride forward
a touch fuller this time, defended on the front foot
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and defends
length ball around off, nothing from the pitch. Defends on the front foot
length ball in the corridor, left alone
length ball angling in, worked towards fine leg. Gabriel is slow to the ball, which allows batsmen to come back for the second
short of length angling, some extra bounce this time. Shanto was looking to work it on the leg side, misses and gets hit on the thigh
length ball around off, lunges forward and blocks
length ball around off, defended again
fuller around off, punches it towards long-off after coming forward
length ball around off, defended on the front foot
length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg for a quick single
fuller around middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on from the front foot
length, defended towards cover
presses forward to meet a length ball around off, defended towards cover
length, outside off, angles back in, and he leaves
length, presses forward to defend one
back of a length, punched to mid off
fullish, driven to mid-off
fullish, worked away towards short midwicket, with the incoming angle
full, straight, and driven to long off
flat, quick, and darts this straight. Shanto goes back to play, and is surprised by it a touch. Defended
works it away towards deep backward square with a sweep. Line down leg again
length, angles into him, and draws a forward defensive stroke
fullish, presses forward to drive it back to the bowler
length, but down the leg side, and worked away towards fine leg
length, but down the pads. Tucked away towards fine leg
fullish, down leg side, and worked away towards square leg
length, straighter, and defended
fuller, around off, and he presses forward to meet this under his eye
length, around off, defended back towards the bowler
length, he presses forward to defend with soft hands
length, presses forward to defend
fires this in a little quicker, and Shadman looks to press forward to defend. Off the pads, and pops up, but lands ahead of silly point
presses forward to defend one around off
presses forward to defend a straighter ball
flighted, outside off, and he opens the face of his bat and drives this through the extra cover region. Pulls up well ahead of the boundary
full, around off, and he defends
length, down leg, and he works this away, but there's a square short midwicket in place
length, defended
full, down the pads, and he can work this towards deep square leg. Easy two
length, around the pads again, and he works it away to fine leg
length, around off, defended
length, presses forward to defend
full, on the pads, swept away towards long leg
presses forward to defend one around off
beats the outside edge this time! Fires this in a touch quicker, and it turns from outside off. Shadman goes back to defend, and plays inside the line
drives a fuller ball towards cover
works this off his pads towards square leg and picks up a quick single
full, down the leg side, bowled at 124.4 kph
length, angles across Shadman, who leaves. Keeps low and bounces before going through to the keeper
length, around off, and he works it along the leg side to the left of mid on
length, a bit of movement after pitching outside off, and he presses forward to defend. This was bowled at about 124 kph
length, around off, defended with a forward press towards short midwicket
length, defends with a forward press
short, wide, and he goes back to cut this through cover-point. Well struck, and there's no protection in the deep
presses forward to smother one around off
flatter, a little more round-arm, and he defends from the crease
bite, and bounce! Da Silva goes up in appeal, but that was too good for the batsman. Turning away from outside off, and he responds really well to the poor first ball
driven, and beats a diving wide cover. Will pick up a single before long off can come around to that
down the pads, and worked away fine. They will be able to come back for the second
fullish, around off, driven to mid off
fullish, driven to mid on this time
length, wide outside off, left alone
fuller, straighter, driven back to the bowler
short of a length, and he goes back to punch this towards point. A diving stop there keeps the batsmen from considering runs
full, driven hard, but straight to the left of short midwicket, who makes a diving stop away to his left
presses forward to defend
straighter, and he presses to defend
length, and he goes back to play this. Allows it to spin and straighten, before defending
flatter, a bit more round-arm, and he defends
outside off, swept away in front of square. Very good from Shanto, as he keeps it flat
fullish, driven hard, but fielded at wide cover

length, angles straight into him, and he works this away towards fine leg. There's some confusion in the running as they want two, and that has led to a calamitious run out! Shadman, who played the shot was looking for two, but Kemar Roach was quick to get across to the ball. Shadman had almost made his way across for the second, but then Shanto realised he had to get a move-on. The throw to da Silva was relayed to Mayers, who whipped the bails off well in time. Shanto sits with his head in his gloves, realising the scale of that error
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend
fuller, around off, and he presses forward to defend
length, defends towards point with a little forward press
full, driven towards mid off
length, defended back down the wicket
fullish, and he defends
length, straightens after pitching around leg, and he defends
length, outside off, and he stretches forward to defend
defends with a forward press
fired in quicker, and he defends it with a dead bat from the crease
length, and he defends with a forward press
fullish, outside off, left alone
wide of the crease, from around the wicket, and angles back in from outside off. Bowled at 140.2 kph, and he leaves
fullish, around off, and he defends
back of a length, jams it with soft hands towards point. Wants a single, but his captain sends him back immediately
full, around off, defended back to the bowler
full toss, driven hard to mid off
length, straightens after pitching around middle. Defended with a forward press
presses forward to smother one around off and middle
wide of off, driven to cover
length, but just down the pads. Worked away towards fine leg
flatter, quicker, and he stretches forward to defend
length, and he goes back and plays an attractive cut. Cannot beat backward point, though
full, wide of off, and left alone
full toss, worked away with a little flick, but cannot beat mid on

short, and he plays this towards forward short leg! Just bounced before it was taken. Umpire Illingworth is checking with the TV umpire, though. Soft signal is not out.. Comfortably bounced before it was taken
fuller, straighter, defended towards short midwicket. More compact from Mominul as well

ooh, almost through to short leg! Searing pace with an incoming short delivery, and Mominul gets into a bit of a tangle. Off the arm, and possibly the glove as well, but drops just short of the man at short leg
short, outside off, defended with a hop towards the slips
length, just around off, and defended from the crease
length, around off, defended with a forward press
driven with the turn towards long on
length, a bit more turn, but he plays it with a dead bat
flights this, outside off, and Mominul has a bit of a swipe at it. Misses, but there's no edge on this
driven firmly to long on
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, blocked solidly in the direction of mid-on
fuller on the stumps, flicked straight towards square leg
short of length in the channel, Mominul stays inside the line of the ball
didn't come out of the hand properly. Landed halfway down and way outside the leg stump, Joshua Da Silva had not chance of cutting this off. Five wides
short of length at the batsman, tucked away behind square leg for a quick single
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
fuller on the off stump, driven down the ground but Roach intercepts it in his follow-through
fuller outside off, driven square of the wicket. The covers fielder puts in the chase to keep it to two
fuller around off, driven again but this time straight towards short extra cover
length ball, came slower off the wicket, Mominul was early into the defence. The ball hits the inner half and bounces in front of square leg
angling on to the pads this time, flicked away to the right of square leg. Was in the air for a while but well away from the fielder
pitched up outside off, driven but fails to beat short extra cover once again
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on
length ball in the channel, left alone
length ball on the pads, worked towards fine leg
length ball around off, stays in his crease and taps it towards mid-off
short of length outside off, rises with the bounce and drops it down
fuller and angling down the leg side, Mominul fails to connect the flick
fuller around off, pushes it towards short extra cover
length ball around off, comes on the front foot and defends it under his eyes
slower one on the stumps, Shadman is watchful and defends it with a straight bat
short of length around off, gets on his toes and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and blocks again
length ball angling in, Shadman was looking to work it on the leg side, looks to flick but gets a leading edge on the off side. Safe though
short of length and rising towards the batsman, stays back and dabs it down on the leg side
fuller around off, moves across a bit and defends it towards mid-on
length, some width outside off, Mominul is quick to spot the opportunity and cuts it past point
length ball angling in, Mominul is right behind it and blocks
fuller outside off, looks to defend on the back foot but the ball hits the outer half and rolls towards point
fuller around off and angling in, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the stumps, defended once again from the front foot
length, a bit of turn this time, blocked again with a forward stride
length ball, a touch outside off this time, comes forward and defends again
fuller around off, defended on the front foot
short of length, goes back and punches it towards cover
length ball in the channel. Left alone
fuller outside off, driven firmly but short cover makes the stop
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
driven uppishly this time but just short of the short cover fielder. Was a length ball outside off, Mominul wasn't to the pitch of the ball but decided to drive on the up
length ball around off, defended this time
length outside off, left alone
fuller and wider outside off, looks to drive but the bat face closes too early and it rolls on the leg side
tossed up around off, pushed back towards the bowler
flighted again, driven past the non-striker. Warrican dives across but cannot stop it
length ball around off, looks to defend but the ball spins to take the inner half and roll behind square leg
fuller on the stumps, driven firmly back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, lunges forward and blocks
goes for the short one but ends up pitching it too short. Outside off as well and it balloons towards the keeper
fuller outside off, leans into the drive. Goes squarer this time but cannot beat the cover fielder
short of length around off, stands tall and blocks
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, goes for the flick but misses. Is hit on the pads but it was angling down
too full, too straight. Punches straight down the ground where mid-off puts in the chase to save a couple of runs
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball at the stumps, defended
fuller around middle and spinning in, pushed on the leg side with a front-foot stride
length ball spinning on to the pads, flicked towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards short midwicket
fuller around off, drives it towards long-on
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball angling on to the pads, tucked away towards square leg
fuller around off, a tentative push towards short cover
fuller and wider, driven uppishly towards the right of the cover fielder
short of length to get Shadman hopping. The ball rolls towards point off the outer half as the batsman looks to defend
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, drives it down to long-on
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, pushes on the leg side
length ball on the leg stump, comes forward and blocks. Bat and pad but it stays low
fuller on the stumps whipped towards mid-on
length ball on the pads, a bit of turn. Shadman looks to defend on the front foot, gets an inside edge to the left of short leg
length ball at the stumps, defended on the leg side
length ball on the pads, goes for the flick but cannot beat square leg
fuller outside off, pushes it towards mid-off
fuller outside off, mistimes the drive towards mid-off
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the pads, flicked gently towards square leg
dropped short, goes back and pulls but cannot get the timing right. Only a single to deep midwicket
length ball on the pads, flicked towards backward square leg
fuller on the stumps, flicked but a diving short midwicket prevents any runs
tossed up on the stump, flicked but it hits short leg on the full
length ball down the leg side, helped towards short fine leg
short and pulled away this time, swivelled four to deep square leg. Those are just going to sit at Mayers' pace on this wicket
fuller outside off, defended on the front foot
length ball on the pads, played gently in front of square leg
fuller on the pads and picked away this time. Four more to deep square leg, and the hundred is up for Bangladesh
length ball outside off, punched towards short cover
length ball at the stumps, defended
short, and a bit of width. Rocks back to cut this away towards backward point
length, defends from the crease as it turns back into him from outside off
presses forward to drive to mid off
length, and he presses forward to defend
full, and he drives this firmly back down the wicket. A hand on it from the bowler
firm drive, with the turn, towards mid on
Mominul goes back to punch towards point
fired in quicker, and straighter, and he shuffles across to block
presses forward to smother one around off
flatter, and he presses forward to defend
looks to go aerial, and doesn't get a hold of it. Looks to go towards mid-wicket, but gets the outside of the bat. Skews towards long off, but lands well short of the ma there
works with the angle into him, and plays it away to long leg
length, played off the back foot, with the turn, towards deep midwicket
length, presses forward to defend
length, around off, and he stretches forward to defend
flat, around leg, and whipped away. There's a short fine leg in place, though
flighted, and he comes down the wicket, and gets it to land between long on, deep midwicket, and mid on running backwards.
length ball, angles into him from middle, and he defends
length, goes back to punch this towards deep cover
defends off the back foot
length, driven with a little forward press. There's a wide cover in place, though
length, defended from the crease
goes back to cut, but cannot beat backward point
length, and played with a neat forward press
length, outside off, and he crunches a cover drive. Shannon Gabriel, at wide mid off, dives away to his right, but cannot reel it back in. And that's Shadman's second Test fifty!
length, goes back and cuts this towards deep point. Easy single
length, presses forward to defend
straighter, whipped away towards mid-wicket. Does well to keep it down
driven back to the bowler
worked off his pads towards deep backward square leg
length, goes back to defend
drives with a forward press towards long off
length, and he goes back to work it off his pads. Struck on the pads, but the ball is probably sliding down leg
defends from the crease
presses forward to defend one
length, goes back to defend towards cover-point
length, goes back to work this off his pads. Fielded at square leg
presses forward to defend
worked off his pads, but fielded by Bonner at short leg
length, gets behind the line to defend one spinning back in from outside off

that's the wicket! The game of patience pays off for West Indies. Warrican tosses this up around off and middle, and Mominul presses forward, hoping to whip it away through the onside. Unable to keep a lofted drive down, and John Campbell at short midwicket takes a sharp catch after a little wobble early on. Whoops of joy from the West Indies camp, who know that Mominul Haque can really grind the opposition away once he sets himself up
length, defended at full stretch forward
length, outside off, tapped away towards backward point
strays down the pads, and he is able to work it off his hips towards long leg to get off the mark
full, ouside off, and driven wide of cover. This was bowled at 139.5 kph
length, around off, defended with a dead bat
length, around off, jagging back in, and he presses forward to defend
length, zips back in from around off, and he almost falls over in trying to work this away on the onside. Bat first, then perhaps a bit of pad, and through towards short mid-wicket
fullish, around off and middle, defended
length, goes back to work it around his pads. Through towards short leg, but along the ground
goes back and tries to whip this away. Strikes Bonner at short leg. Funny for all of his teammates
full, driven back to the bowler
length, around off, loops away, and he drives it back towards the bowler, who gets down low to his left to stop it
length, angles from around middle, and he defends
short, and he goes back to smack this away. Along the ground to square leg
fullish, and he blocks it with a forward stride. Placed to the left of mid on, and they can pinch a single
short, outside off, and he drives it off the back foot, but straight to cover
full, wide, and he looks to drive. Off the bottom of the bat, back towards the bowler to his right
full, around off, and he is lulled into a drive. Bottom hand comes off, as he realises he's nowhere near the pitch of this 144.8 kph delivery
length, and he plays this wide of cover. They pick up a quick single
fullish, around off, and he punches this to the left of mid off. A diving stop will prevent this from going for four
straightens from around leg and middle. Off the edge, but along the ground
defends with a forward press
length, around off, stretches forward to defend towards point, with soft hands
full, down the pads, and swept towards deep backward square leg
sweeps this hard, from around leg and middle. Square leg dives across to stop it, but ends up parrying it away. They are able to pick up one for that
fullish, defended to short mid-wicket
short, and he goes back to punch this through extra cover. Easy put away, and well done by Rahim
full, wide of off, and left alone
fuller, around off, and defended
short of a length, around off, and he can cut this away to the sweeper positioned at backward point
length, around off, nips back in, and he presses forward to defend
length, and he goes back to punch this from outside off towards point
full, and he looks to drive this. A bit of late movement in the air, and that means this skews off the inside edge, but safely away from off stump
fullish, around off, driven to wide cover

full, goes for the sweep, and after a concerted appeal, that's been given! Shadman opts not to go for the review, because I think he realises he's made a mess of judgement here. Too full for the sweep, and Warrican has always kept things within the stumps in this spell of his. Once it sped past his outside edge, it was always more likely to fall in his favour. This is a massive wicket for the West Indies, with tea looming!
sharp turn from around off and middle, and Shakib shapes to glance. Beats him, and Da Silva behind the stumps, to run away towards fine leg. Will pull up ahead of the boundary, though
works one with the turn towards square leg
full, driven to mid on
worked off his pads towards fine leg
full, on the pads as it swings back into him, and he can work it away towards deep backward square

drives one around off, towards mid off. A bit of indecision, as Rahim doesn't respond to Shakib's call for a single, but he has enough time to recover his ground after having taken a few steps down the pitch
back of a length, and he guides this towards point
fullish, on the pads, and worked away towards deep square leg
full, around middle and leg, slanting further in, and he defends
length, and he presses forward to defend
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
short and wide, goes back and punches it through covers for four
length ball on the pads, flicked behind square leg for one
length ball from outside off, bounce and turn. Mushfiqur does well to keep it away from short leg
goes for the slog sweep and nails it. Dispatches it to the deep square leg boundary
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards long-on from the front foot. Ten runs from the first over after tea and with that, 150 comes up as well
length ball at the stumps, tucked away towards square leg
length ball but down the leg side, left alone
length ball on the stumps, turns it towards square leg
fuller around off, Mushfiqur comes forward and punches it towards mid-on
length ball at the stumps, defended with a straight bat
length ball angling, gets behind it and blocks. A maiden
fuller outside off, comes forward and blocks
length ball outside off, pushes it towards covers for a quick single
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, whipped towards deep square leg
fuller outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards cover
length ball around off, defended
short of length outside off, enough room as well. Mushfiqur stands tall and punches it to the right of the point fielder for another boundary
length ball around off, looks to drop and run but the point fielder was quick to the ball
fuller around off, pushes it past the bowler, the mid-off cuts it off
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball outside off, Mushfiqur just waits for it before opening the face of the bat to run it down towards the vacant third-man region
short of length, goes back and cuts but cannot beat the point
fuller outside off, pushes it towards cover
length ball on the stumps, goes back and push it gently towards mid-on for a quick single
length ball on the stumps, defended around the corner
length outside off, spinning in, goes back and punches it trough covers for a couple
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards short midwicket
short of length outside off, worked towards square leg
length ball around off, pushes it towards mid-on
short of length, just outside off but Shakib goes for the cut and gets it fine. There is no one at third man and Bangladesh pick another boundary in that area
fuller around off, pushes it towards mid-off
length ball around off, defended on the off side
length outside off, driven on the up but straight towards extra cover
length ball outside off, goes back and punches it through covers
length ball on the stumps, defended
fuller outside off, driven towards mid-off from the front foot
fuller outside off, driven through covers where the fielder chases it to keep it to one
fuller on the stumps, defended under his eyes
length ball on the pads, turns it towards short midwicket
a floating full toss on the off stump, pushed towards long-off
length ball outside off, goes for the cut and gets beaten as there is no room available
fuller on the stumps, misses the sweep and is hit on the pads. An appeal for lbw but looked like it was going down
fuller on the stumps, defended towards short midwicket
fuller again, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the stumps, defended from the back foot
fuller on middle and leg, lunges forward and pushes it on the leg side
length ball on the pads, flicks it towards short midwicket
length ball outside off, defended from the back foot
uses his feet this time, drives along the ground but straight towards mid-on

another loud appeal for lbw, denied but West Indies are going for the review this time. Was fuller on the stumps, Shakib missed the sweep. Don't think there was any bat involved. The impact is umpire's call, just on the leg stump and it was going down. West Indies lose their review
goes for the sweep again and this time gets the connection right. Sends it to the deep square leg boundary
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller outside off, driven towards long-off
fuller around off, defended on the front foot
fuller on the stumps, flicks it towards short midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and works it towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-off
too full on the stumps, punched back
down the track but reaches too close to the ball, hits back towards the bowler
too full this time, digs it out towards the bowler
use of feet once again but doesn't middle it this time. Rolls towards mid-on
and he skips down once more. From the outer half of the bat towards mid-off this time and they sneak in a single
fuller on the stumps, works it behind square leg
pitched up, worked towards short midwicket
tossed up full around off, stays back and defends. Was in two minds there for a moment
length ball on the stumps, defended
flighted on middle and leg, flicked towards short midwicket
pitched up on the stumps, pushed back
length ball around off, stays back and looks to drop and run, Da Silva was quick to the ball though
fuller on the stumps, lunges forward and blocks
down the track and hits it hard but straight towards the bowler
length ball on the pads, turned around the corner and Mushfiqur was quick to spot the single
fuller down the leg side, goes for the sweep but misses
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards deep extra cover for a quick single
short of length outside off, rocks back and punches it hard through covers. A valiant effort by the cover fielder to chase and put in a slide but it goes in vain
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
pitched up outside off, defended on the front foot

fullish, worked away towards square leg
down the wicket, and looks to slice this over mid-off. Shannon Gabriel jumps up and parries it away. Technically has to go down as a drop, but a good effort
fullish, works this away towards fine leg, and scampers two
outside off, defended

length, around off, and he presses forward to defend. Flies low off the edge, and Cornwall fails to get across to it. It was dying on him, to his left, but he could have held on. Has to be called a drop then!
under-edge, and runs past the keeper, between his legs, down to third man
length, driven towards wide cover
goes back to punch this towards wide cover
short, and he cuts this away to point. A half-stop, but they will be able to pick up two
length, goes back and defends
fullish, around off, and defended after shuffling across
fullish, and he shuffles across. Sweeps hard, and gets it wide of both leg slip and short fine leg
thrown full, and he looks to wind up and slam him down the wicket. Off the inner edge towards short fine leg
length, and he goes back, and then defends one spinning back into him
presses forward to defend
length, shuffles across, gets behind the line of one pitching just outside off, and drops it dead at his feet
driven hard to cover
goes back to defend one pitching around leg and turning across him
length, and he goes back to defend
fullish, and he goes back to work it off his feet towards fine leg
length, driven to cover

Nayeem pays for playing back to the spinner! Bonnger gets one to pitch around leg stump, and Nayeem plays back to it. Inside edge, and then perhaps just a bit of his pad, and then through to the stumps. He watches on in disbelief, before dragging himself away. Bonner celebrates his first Test wicket. Importantly, West Indies put an end to a partnership that began as a mild irritation, but has probably now shut one half of the door on them!
fullish, down leg stump, and left alone
length, and he plays it off the back foot
fullish, around leg stump, and he plays a reverse paddle. Wanted to get more length on it, but it trickled away towards point. Just a single on for him
fullish, straight, and defended
length, and worked away towards deep square leg
defends with an open face towards point
length, and he goes back and cuts this away past backward point. He does love his cuts and late cuts, doesn't he?
short, goes back and cuts this hard. Some work for the sweeper cover, and he gets two to move to 99!
length, stretches forward to defend one around off

paddle swept away, and immediately revels in his achievement! Goes back for the second, and then takes his helmet off to acknowledge the cheers of his teammates. Gets down on his knees to perform the sajdah and kiss the pitch. Sensational stuff from Mehidy. He has ridden his luck, on occasion, but this has been superb counterpunching from no.8
presses forward to defend one around off
length, around off, and defended with a forward press
full, and defended with a little forward press
sharp turn, across him, as he looks to press forward and defend. There's turn, but slow again!
defends a fuller, straighter ball, with a little forward press
wide of the crease, angles in, and then turns away as it goes past the outside edge
fuller, around off, and he defends. Does well to keep it low, with silly point looming in his vision
leaves one turning across him from just outside off
length, goes back to defend one around off
length, goes back to one and defends
goes back and punches one to long off
length, and he presses forward to defend one
swipes one across the line, picking it out of off stump, but playing it with the turn. Goes to deep square leg
fired in a touch quicker, and he punches this down the ground towards long on
length, worked away with the turn towards short mid-wicket

down the wicket, and holed out to long on! Cornwall tosses this up around off and middle, and he has a big swipe at it, after stepping down the track. Probably wants to go straight, but it skews off the inner part of the bat, and carries all the way to the man just by the rope. Healthy cheers as he walks off
stars with a length ball on middle and leg and Brathwaite puts it away expertly in front of square leg
length ball at the stumps, stays in the crease and blocks
length ball in the channel, left alone
length again, pitching outside off and swinging back in, left alone
fuller around off this time, comes forward and blocks
fuller in the channel, and angling further away, left alone
fuller around off, comes forward and turns it towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and block
too full, drives it towards long-on to get off the mark
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards cover
dances down the track but Shakib pulls his length back. Defended in the end
flighted around off, defended with a big front-foot stride
length ball around off, gets behind the line of the ball and defends
length ball around off, hops and defends it towards point
length ball in the channel, moving away from the left-hander. Left alone
fuller and wider outside off, pushes it towards covers
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards fine leg
length ball at the stumps, defended from the back foot
flighted around off, Campbell goes for the drive but gets it from the inner half of the bat. A single to deep square leg
length ball outside off, punched it towards backward point
length ball at the stumps, backs away and punches it on the off side
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
down the track and lofts it up and over the mid-on's head, Brathwaite showing intent here
length ball at the stumps and defends
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller outside off, driven firmly but finds the cover fielder

a big appeal for lbw and Bangladesh go for the review. Was a length ball outside off that kept coming in with the angle. Campbell looked to flick it around his front pad and misses. Not bat involved and it would have gone on to hit middle and leg. West Indies lose their first wicket

Another big appeal for lbw and given. A length ball angling in once again, Moseley plants his front foot forward and is cramped as he looks to push at it. West Indies go for the review and it shows there's a big inside edge
length ball in the channel, left alone
defends the flighted delivery from the crease
fuller on the stumps, pushed to the right of the bowler. Shakib looks to stop it with his foot but fails and concedes a single
length ball spinning in, turned away on the leg side
fuller outside off, pushed towards mid-off
length ball around off, defended
length on middle and leg, turns it on the leg side
length outside off, goes on with the angle, Brathwaite looks to push at it and gets beaten
length ball in the channel, left alone this time
length ball in the channel, shouldered arms once more
length ball around off, defended
length in the channel, looks to play at it initially but withdraws at the last moment. Mustafizur has bowled a big no-ball here
length ball at the stumps, pushed towards midwicket for a quick single

an appeal for caught-behind but given not out. Bangladesh want to review this. A length ball outside off, nipping back in to cut Moseley in half. There is no bat involved and it hit him high on the thigh. The impact is umpire's call as is the wickets
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards covers
length ball around off, stays back and defends
short and wide this time, cuts it through covers for a couple
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
slower in the air this time. Brathwaite was early into the forward defence but adjusts well in the end
dropped short this time, Brathwaite rocks back and pulls it through midwicket for four
length ball outside off, punched on the off side from the back foot
length ball in the channel, shouldered arms
length ball in the channel, left alone
fuller around off, a positive stride forward and full face of the bat to push it back towards the bowler
a bouncer this time, Mustafizur mixing it up well here but Moseley ducks under it comfortably
fuller on the stumps, another positive stride to punch it down the ground. Mid-on cuts it off though
tossed up around off, Brathwaite whips it past short midwicket for one
fuller on the stumps, goes down and sweeps it fine. Gets a couple as the slip fielder puts in the chase
full on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
fuller on the stumps again. Comes forward and blocks
length ball outside off, lunges forward and blocks
fuller outside off, pushed towards covers
length ball on the stumps, looks to work on the leg side but the ball hits the outer half and rolls towards covers
length ball in the channel, left alone
length ball around fifth stump, moves across and defends
length outside off, stays inside the line and taps it towards cover-point

fuller delivery at the stumps and Moseley once again has got himself in a tangle as the ball comes in with the angle. An appeal for lbw but denied. Mominul is checking with the wicketkeeper and decides to go for the review. There is a bit of a murmur on the UltraEdge as the ball passes the bat and that's enough for the third umpire to make a decision. Bangladesh lose a review

a searing yorker and this time it's been given lbw. The batsman goes for the review straightaway. Moseley was late to get his bat down and the ball hit the shoe almost on the full and it would have crashed into middle and leg. Mustafizur gets his second on a pitch that had hardly offered anything for the seamers till tea
fuller on the stumps, defended
pitched on around off and middle. Brathwaite looks to defend but gets beaten as the ball turns sharply. Think it was going down
fuller again and this time swept hard behind square leg for four
fuller around off, defended from the crease
length ball at the stumps, nudges it towards short midwicket
a huge appeal for bat-pad but it died down quickly as the umpire said no. Was a length ball on the pads, Brathwaite looked to work it on the leg side but missed. Off the pad to short leg
length ball around off, defended with half a step forward
a touch fuller and straighter this time, blocked on the front foot
length ball in the channel, left alone
fuller outside off, pushes it towards cover-point
fuller around off, pushes it back towards the bowler
short this time and Bonner swivels to pull it to the deep square leg boundary
short, turns back into him slowly, and he can go back to thwack this towards deep mid-wicket
floated wide outside off, and full, driven towards point
length, around off, turns back in, and he defends off the back foot
fuller, driven to silly mid-on. There's a throw at the striker's end, which deflects off the keeper's pads and runs away towards short fine leg
length, goes deep in the crease and works it towards deep backward square leg
length, drives it with a forward press
negotiates this with the turn towards silly mid-on
skips down the wicket, and drives it back to the bowler
defends with a forward press, around off
presses forward and smothers one around off
skips down the wicket, and picks a single towards mid-on, who is three-quarters of the way to the boundary
tossed up, and lazy elegance as he drives through cover. Past the man at short cover, and through the extra cover region
presses forward to defend one around off
down the wicket, and slashes this through the air, but wide of short mid-wicket. Placed wide of long-on as well. Great intent from the captain
length, and he goes back to work this off his pads towards deep fine leg. Shakib runs after this from the slips and pulls it back, but seems a bit uncomfortable after that
length, defended back to the bowler
goes back to cut this, and Miraz gets sharp turn. Defended at the last minute
length, around off, and he stretches far forward. Misses the line, playing outside it, but he's well outside the line
length, and he goes back to punch this towards point
length, and he stretches forward to defend
length, way outside off, sharp turn across him, and left alone
length, around off and middle, and he stretches forward to defend
length, and he goes back to punch this to wide cover
tossed up, and he goes for the expansive drive. Cannot beat wide cover, though
fullish, around off, and he strikes this with an open face of the bat. Has struck Shadman Islam, fielding at silly point, somewhere on his leg
length, and he goes back to punch this to cover-point
fuller, outside off, and he stretches to pad this away, hiding his bat behind his pad
cut hard, backing away, but straight to point
too full, and he flows into a lazy drive through the extra cover region
length, and he goes back to defend this. Needs to be careful not to get stuck in the crease
goes back and defends one around off, spinning back in
length, spins back in and he defends
presses forward to defend one
driven against the spin through deep mid-wicket. Keeps running away from the man chasing from mid-wicket
fullish, around leg and middle, and he works it away towards wide mid-on
defends one off the back foot. It turns and squares him up a bit. Played well in the end
fullish, and he squares up a bit again as he looks to defend. Eventually played away towards cover
length, works it with the turn towards square leg. Didn't go a long way at all, and the fielder at short leg was quick to move across to it, and thankfully, he had not gone too far
driven hard back to the bowler
leaves one floated outside off, not with any great turn back into him
straighter, flatter, and he looks to pull. Miscued, to begin with, but it lands short of short fine leg. Then there's a shy at the stumps, but he's just turned back in time
length, outside off, as he stretches to defend. Would have struck him outside the line, though there's an appeal
back of a length, and he goes back to punch this towards long off
fullish, around off, driven back to the left of the bowler
fired in quicker, struck him as he plays back. Probably sliding down leg. There's a massive appeal, and the umpire says no. They don't go for the review, though
length, plays forward to defend this to the off side
length, goes back to cut this, but cannot get it past point
length, and he stretches forward to defend
flatter again, down the leg side, and he works it off his pads towards fine leg
fullish, around off, and he skips down the wicket to drive. Almost yorks himself. Played back to the bowler
defends with a forward press
length, around off, and he comes down the wicket. Tries to flick, but misses. Struck outside the line
defends with a little forward press
shorter, and he goes back to whip this away towards mid-wicket
length ball, delivered from quite deep in the crease, and he goes back to work this with the turn towards midwicket
length, goes back to defend
fuller, driven back to the bowler
goes back to cut one. It's close to off stump, and he drives towards short cover
wide of the crease, a bit flat, and turns a fair amount. Brathwaite goes back and swats it away towards point
armer, bowled with pace, and he goes back to defend
length, and he stretches forward to defend towards mid-on
length, around off, and he plays a delicate late cut. Runs away towards third man, and forces slip to go chasing after. Easy two once the fielder failed to gather with a dive initially
short, wide of off, and cut away to deep point
length, turns back in, and he defends
length, but width on offer, and he can go back and cut this away towards deep point again
length, a bit of bounce on this, negotiated with a forward press
length, defends pressing forward
length, presses forward to defend
presses forward to defend
length, around off, defended with a forward press
short, and he hangs back to cut this hard towards deep cover
fuller, driven towards deep cover
presses forward to smother one around off
length, worked with the spin towards square leg. They want a quick single, but decide against it as the fielder attacks the ball to his left
fuller length, invites the drive. Stretches forward to defend
length, turns a bit more from around off, and Brathwaite stretches forward to defend. Does well to take his bottom hand off, and allow the ball to die down by his feet
length, driven with the turn towards silly mid-on
length, outside off, and he drops it to the left of point
length, goes back to work it with the spin towards deep square leg
fullish, driven wide of cover
full, driven between cover-point and point
fullish again, straighter in line, and driven to long-on
presses forward to defend one straight at him

driven, wide of cover, but towards the man at a slightly deeper extra cover
fuller, driven to mid-off
length, presses forward to defend
fired in a touch quicker, defended towards square leg
length, worked away with the spin, off the back foot, past short leg. Easy single, with no mid-wicket close to the bat
length, worked off the back foot towards short midwicket
length, outside off, and he stretches forward to defend. Strikes pad, as he plays with bat just behind pad
short, and he looks to pull this, but cannot place it beyond the man at square leg
length, around leg and middle, and he works it with his wrists towards deep square leg. Easy two taken before fine leg can get across to his left and field this
length, wider of off, and he defends
length, around off, defended. Bowled at 133.5 kph
fuller, around off, and he defends with a forward press
length, around off, defended

oh, that was close! It's the cutter, and it takes Brathwaite's edge, and flies through the vacant second slip region. Went along the ground, to be fair, but that was good bowling by Mustafizur. Fittingly, it leaves Brathwaite unbeaten, and a run away from fifty

gobbled up at slip! What a start this is for Bangladesh. Taijul puts it on a sixpence around off, and Bonner stretches forward to defend. It spins enough to catch the outside edge and flies to the left of Najmul Hossain Shanto at first slip, who holds on. Taijul lets out a whoop!
length, around off, and he stretches forward to defend
length, goes back to punch it back towards the bowler

edged again, but this has not gone to hand! Presses forward to defend, and it takes the outside edge. Takes a bit of the pads of Liton Das, and then Shanto just gets his fingertips. Technically dropped then
defends with the turn
length, and he goes back to punch it back towards the bowler
fullish, left alone
length, and he defends
length, angles back in from over the wicket, and he jams his bat down in time, to chop it towards the on side
fuller, straighter, and he plays this beautifully. Punched back down the ground, to the left of the bowler, between the stumps and the non-striker
length, wider of off, and he leaves. Some late shape, but he had watched it through
back of a length, and he hangs back and punches this through covers
length, and he goes back to punch this to cover-point
wide of the crease, speared in towards leg and middle, and straightens. Met with a straight, dead bat
floated up closer to him, and he flicks, but cannot beat short midwicket
down the wicket, and tries to drive this firmly, but cannot beat mid-on
length, goes back and works this towards fine leg. Brings up fifty for the captain
flights this, and gives it some extra revs from outside off. Mayers can go back and defend one that spins back in a long way
length ball, around 132 kph, and on off stump. He defends after covering the line
length, around off, and he gets closer to the ball, opens the face of his bat and runs it just wide of point to pinch an easy single
full, and cover driven with ease again. There's a catching short cover, but that just went like a bullet past him
length, and width, and he slashes this hard, through point. There's a sweeper in the deep for this shot
length, outside off, and he has a nibble at that. Just past the outside edge and through to Liton. Perhaps a bit of seam movement away...great bowling!
uppish drive back past the bowler to a length ball around off, and has enough legs to go to the long-off boundary
length, goes back to punch towards mid-wicket
length, goes back and defends
fuller, driven to long on
fullish, and he stretches forward to smother this. Played towards short mid-wicket
length, straightens after pitching around middle, and he defends
goes back to cut this hard, but cannot beat point
fuller, turns away after pitching outside off, and Brathwaite leaves
length, and he stretches forward to defend. Keeps a bit low, and goes off the edge, through the gully region
length, turns across him. Well defended towards point
length, defended off the back foot towards cover-point
short, and cut away through the cover-point region. Places it to the right of the only man at wide cover
length, pitches closer to the batsman, and turns across him. Left alone
stretches to defend one around off
short, and he can go back and cut this after it turns wide of off, and plays it through the extra cover region
short again, and this time he hits it more square of the wicket. Finds the gap between point and cover-point to perfection
still a bit short, and he is able to go through extra cover again. There's protection in the deep now for him
defends one turning back into him
length, goes back to punch this to short cover
length, sharp turn back in from around off. Looks to defend off the back foot. Strikes him on the pad, but definitely sliding down leg
length, and he goes back to whip this away towards square leg
length, goes back to one that turns from off into him. Defends
length, played with the spin across him, towards square leg. Needs to be wary of the short leg in place
fuller, invites the drive, with a silly mid-on in place. Driven towards mid-off
fuller, around off, and he blocks
length, and he goes back to guide this towards point. Easy single on offer, and taken
short again, and he can guide this towards deep point off the back foot after watching it turn
fuller, and he defends
tossed up, straighter, and he drives back down the wicket. Fielded by Taijul to his left
length, goes back to punch this with the turn towards short midwicket
just a bit short, and he can go back to punch towards cover. Mushfiqur Rahim at short cover parries it away and allows a single
fullish, and he defends with a forward press
length, and he goes back to punch to wide cover
length, and he pushes forward to defend. An appeal for leg before, but it did seem that he played that off the face of the bat
short, turns a bit extra, but gives enough time to thwack this inside out, along the ground, to the sweeper at deep cover
length, and he goes back to turn it into a much shorter ball. Pulled away backward of square, and gets four for his effort
length, a bit of extra bounce around off, and he defends well, riding the bounce, towards point
length, played off the back foot again, back towards the bowler
length, and he goes back to punch this back towards silly mid-on
length, goes back to slash this towards point
worked away with the turn towards square leg
punched with the turn towards deep mid-on
shot! Quick shimmy down the wicket, and then driven hard towards long-on. No fielder there, and that also brings up the fifty-run partnership between these two
worked against the turn towards deep square leg, and will fetch him two more
fullish, on leg stump, and he works this away towards mid-on. Easy single, as Tamim has to move across to his left

that's done him in! It's a fullish ball, around off, and Brathwaite lets it pass through, and hears the death rattle behind him. Perhaps the first real error from the West Indies captain, and it is a fatal one. Turns a fair distance, and strikes the top of off. Nayeem punches the air in delight. Bangladesh break this brisk partnership!
length, turns back into him, and he looks to defend. Runs off his pads, and is taken at slip
length, goes back to this and defends
was that edged? Yes, Blackwood plays back to one, that doesn't turn as much as he thinks. Off the edge, and between Liton's legs towards long stop
length, played off the back foot
flattish, down leg side, and left alone
length, goes back to punch towards point
pushes forward to defend one around off
short of a length, goes back to punch it to short cover
flatter, around off, defended off the back foot

cuts this hard, and gets it past point. This will run away for four, despite the man there getting some fingers on to that. Short in length again from Taijul, whose control over length has been a bit poor this morning
length, around off, turning back into him. Played with the spin towards square leg
length, pushes forward to defend
length, driven off the back foot towards short cover
length, goes back to punch this to mid-wicket
fuller, turns across from outside off, and he leaves
fullish, and he looks to flick it off his legs. Cannot beat a man at short fine leg
uppish, but just wide of short cover! Beter length from Taijul, draws him forward to drive
and now beats his outside edge with one that spins sharply. Goes back to defend a length ball
length, presses forward to defend this one
length, left alone as it pitches outside off
defends with a forward press
defends with a forward press

length, and he defends with a little movement across the crease
length, driven towards deep mid-on. Wants a single, but is sent back
length, played off the back foot
back of a length, turning across him, off his pads towards short leg
fuller length, and strikes him on the pads as he shapes to flick. Going down leg, though

short of length this time, goes back and punches it through covers. His sixth four in 36 runs

fuller around off and middle, pushed towards short midwicket
pitched up outside off, goes for the cover drive but ends up mistiming it into the ground

length ball spinning in, tucked away towards short fine leg
sharp turn for Nayeem once again. Blackwood was looking to play on the back foot, gets cramped and hit on the pads. Was going down though

spinning in sharply from well outside off, looks to defend but ends up playing inside the line and misses

a touch fuller and Blackwood plants his foot down and drives it to the right of mid-off for another four, 150 comes for West Indies

finally on the front foot. Fuller around off, comes forward and blocks

given lbw and Mayers decides not to review it. Pitched up once again, the batsman was in two minds whether to comes forward or go back. Ends up being neither here nor there. length outside off, defended from the back foot, away from the body

short of length, rocks back and pulls it towards deep midwicket

spinning on to the pads, turned towards short fine leg

swept away hard this time, off the mark with a boundary

extra bounce this time but Blackwood does well to keep it away from short leg. Doesn't carry to short midwicket either

presses forward to defend a length ball closer to the stumps
fullish, and he presses forward to defend
presses forward to defend one around off and middle
flatter, around middle and leg, and he defends
turns across him, but short enough to allow him to go back and punch towards sweeper cover
length, but some width, and he can dab it away towards third man. Deep backward point will come around, but they can pick up two
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend
full, and he works this with the turn towards deep midwicket
hangs back to work it with the turn, towards square leg
fuller, and he defends with a forward press
length, goes back and plays this to deep square leg with the turn
length, turns across him, and beats the outside edge again, as he presses forward to defend
turns across from outside off again. Pushes forward and plays inside the line
backs away a bit, and then cuts a ball that's marginally shorter. Straight to point
length, around off, and he goes back to punch this towards deep mid-on
flatter, and he shapes to flick. Off the edge, says the umpire, as the ball rolls away towards point. Seemed to have hit the pad, but the umpire reckons it was off the bat to begin with
catches the edge, but doesn't carry to Cornwall at slip! Warrican is asking a few questions of Liton Das with that ball spinning away, from a length just around off stump
full toss, and put away through the mid-wicket region
fullish again, and he defends with a little forward press
length, and he goes back to defend as it turns back into him from outside off
short, and he slaps this one away behind square leg. Good shot again from Mominul, who is beginning to look as fluent as he is at his best
length, outside off, and he defends with a drive towards mid-off
length, presses forward to defend one around off
fullish, and he defends with a forward press
defends one around off
fuller, and whipped away towards wide mid-on
drops it short, and he can go back to cut this towards deep point
fullish, driven towards deep cover
goes back to defend a length ball around off, spinning back in
full toss again, and he whips this away towards deep midwicket. Easy two
goes back to cut one to point. A diving stop, but not enough to prevent the single
fullish, around off, and defended towards a short midwicket in place
length, wide outside off, and driven to cover
length, and he goes back to tap it down by his feet after it turns marginally back towards him
flat, and he goes back and thumps this away towards midwicket. There's a deep square leg, who will cut this off away to his right
length, around off, and he looks to tap this to the off side, and sets off. But Da Silva is quick to get to the ball, and prevent the batsmen from pinching a single
goes for the cut, and it doesn't bounce a lot. Off the under edge, down to ground
driven with the turn towards long on
fullish, and he drives to long on. Mominul can't go for the single, because Warrican runs into him inadvertantly!
length, and he goes back to punch this towards deep midwicket
fuller, around off, and he leaves as it spins away
straighter, fuller, and defended with a forward press
goes back to punch one towards deep cover
sweeps from outside off, but there's a man at deep backward square leg for that shot
works one with the angle into him, towards short midwicket
length, presses forward to defend
length, and defended back down the pitch
defends a fuller ball
length, defends with a forward press. No chance of a single, with short cover in place
backs away, and drives, but cannot get it past cover
presses forward to push this to the left of cover. Quick single taken
goes for the sweep and places this fine. That also takes the lead beyond 300! Picks up a length ball around off and middle, and places it well to beat a short fine leg in place
works this with the turn towards square leg. Played with soft hands, and a single taken
presses forward to defend one
presses forward to defend one around off
length, and he allows this to turn back in from around off. Delicately runs it down to the right of short third man, for a single
defends this off the back foot, and gets it down towards third man
length, goes back to defend
length, played off the back foot towards square leg
length, flatter, and defends with a forward press
length, driven wide of midwicket
fullish, pitching on leg and straightening. Defended with the outside of the bat, towards cover
fuller, driven back to the bowler
length, and he looks to whip this through midwicket. Uppish, but way to the left of Brathwaite at short midwicket
down the wicket, and looks to thwack this down the ground. From bat on to pad, and drops towards silly point, but there's no fielder there now
meets a length ball around off, with a forward press
length, defends with a forward press
length, goes back to play this, and it turns across him. Beats the outside edge
allows this turn into him, and he defends
defends off the back foot. Runs away towards short leg, and the keeper goes to stop this
short, and he goes back to cut this to deep point
length, and he stretches forward to defend
fuller, around middle, and he stretches to defend. Uppish, but short of short midwicket
full toss, and dispatched towards deep midwicket
length, works this away towards square leg
full toss, and he works this away towards deep midwicket
full toss, and driven towards long off
defends with a forward press
eased wth the turn towards short midwicket
length outside off, punched towards covers
length around off, blocked again
a touch shorter this time, chopped towards backward point
fuller around off, lofted over extra cover. Although not in complete control, still manages two
fuller again, punched to covers this time
fuller again, pushed towards covers
fuller on the stumps, pushed inside out towards extra cover
length ball at the stumps, blocked on the front foot
pitched up outside off, pushed to extra cover
length ball at the stumps, defended once more
some turn to fetch the outside edge but well short of Cornwall at slip
beats the short extra cover with the inside-out drive this time, but only a single as the man in the deep cuts it off
fuller outside off, driven towards long-on
length outside off, pushes but ends up chipping uppishly on the off side. Well short of extra cover
pitched up outside off, pushed towards extra cover
length ball on the pads, turns it towards square leg
fuller outside off, goes for the slog sweep and gets beaten
tossed up outside off, slaps it towards deep extra cover
fuller on the stumps, pushed back
length outside off, swept towards deep square leg
length ball around off, backs away and pushes it towards deep extra cover
length ball spinning on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg
fuller outside off, pushed towards extra cover
lunges forward and blocks this full ball on the stumps
fuller around off, pushed back towards the bowler
length outside off, taps it towards cover
a bit of extra bounce from a length outside off, dabbed towards point
goes for the cut and beats the point fielder this time, only a single though
length outside off, bat-pad as he lunges forward and the ball lobs on the leg side
tossed up outside off, pushed through covers from the front foot
fuller outside off, driven to the right of extra cover who dives but ends up deflecting it towards mid-off
length outside off, defended
comes forward and drives this fuller delivery towards cover
length ball around off, uses his feet and pushes it towards short midwicket
fuller outside off, nudged towards short extra cover
too full, driven through the line for a single to long-off
fuller outside off, driven gently towards short extra cover
length outside off, defended on the back foot
driven this time, beats short extra cover but cannot the fielder at extra cover
length outside off, defended on the off side, was looking for a single but short extra cover was quick to the ball
tossed up outside off, defended
fuller on the stumps, flicked though midwicket for three, he is into the 90s now
fuller outside off, driven towards extra cover
fuller outside off, lunges forward and pushes it towards mid-on for a quick single
dropped short this time, Das goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller outside off, lunges forward and blocks
length ball, just outside off, dead-batted after a big forward stride
length ball on the stumps, pushed towards short midwicket from the back foot
fuller outside off, pushed towards short midwicket
fuller outside off, flicked towards midwicket for a couple
length ball around off, nudges with the turn towards short midwicket
fuller on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg
length ball around off, looks to drop and run but that extra cover fielder avoids any single
goes for the paddle sweep but ends up top-edging it over the wicketkeeper's head. Moves to 95 with that single
length ball on the leg stump, tucked away towards midwicket
short of length outside off, steers it towards third man
length ball outside off, guided towards third man for one more. These two have added 100 now
length ball around off, opens the face to defend it towards point
fifty for Liton. Short outside off, and Liton cuts it past backward point for four to bring up the milestone
short and wide and smashes it past point once again for back-to-back fours
length ball on the stumps, pushed towards short midwicket
fuller outside off, pushed towards short midwicket
tossed up outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards extra cover
fuller this time, turned towards square leg
fuller outside off, pushes it towards mid-on
length ball on the pads, nudges it towards fine leg for a couple of runs. Moves to 99
fuller on the stumps, flicked behind square leg for a quick two
length ball on the stumps, turns towards square leg
length ball at the stumps, defended
flighted outside off, pushes it towards cover with soft hands and completes his hundred with a quick single. Off comes the helmet as he acknowledges the milestone
short of length outside off, dabbed towards third man for three
length ball outside off, punched towards extra cover
a missed stumping. Down the ground and looks to go inside out. Gets beaten bu the turn but Da Silva fails to collect it properly
driven past extra cover for a couple this time
short of length outside off, finds point with the cut
length outside off, pushed towards covers
fuller on the stumps, defended
length outside off, lunges forward and dead-bats it
short of length outside off, cuts it towards deep point
length ball at the stumps, defended towards short midwicket
length ball at the stumps, defended from the crease
length ball rising towards the batsman, turned towards deep square leg
short and wide, and Mominul cuts it uppishly towards deep point
short of length at the batsman, Liton gets down and drops his hands
short of length, goes back and punches it through extra cover
goes aerial on the leg side this time, doesn't time it well but it lands safely, the deep midwicket moves to his left to pull it back and keep it to two
length ball around off, goes for the reverse sweep this time and gets three to third man, 200 comes up for Bangladesh
Liton uses the reverse sweep this time, and finds the gap behind square. Moves to 69 with that boundary

caught at backward point as he tries another reverse sweep. Was a length ball outside off, the intent was right as Bangladesh are looking for quick runs but Liton ended up hitting it in the air and straight to the fielder this time
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg
clears his front leg and smashes this fuller delivery towards deep extra cover, a fumble there allows an easy second
a full toss on the stumps, Mominul once again keeps his right leg out and smashes it through midwicket this time

caught at deep square leg as Mominul looks for some quick runs. Was deep in the crease this time, the ball was full and went for the big hit. He middled it alright but didn't have enough power to take it all the way. A brilliant knock from the skipper comes to an end
fullish, angles into his pads, and he can work it away to the left of deep midwicket for two
length, around off, and he drives. Uppish, and just beyond cover, to the left of mid-off
late cut, off the back foot, but there's a third man close in on the off side
defends a length ball, pitching on middle and leg, from the crease
short, and he can go back to punch this through the cover region
length, and he goes back to defend
length, and he drives back to the bowler
down the wicket, and launched towards cow corner. Long on is quite wide, and almost gets to it, but it doesn't carry to him anyway
fullish, around off, and driven wide of cover towards mid-off, and they take a quick single
dug in short, and he leaves after ducking
short, and he jabs this away from around off, towards deep backward point
short, but he gets into a bit of a tangle by ducking. Almost ends up swatting it away
full, down the leg side. Good take by Da Silva low to his right
fullish length, driven to mid-on, and they pinch a quick single
length, driven with a forward press towards short midwicket

Taijul looks to lap this, but sees the ball go on to strike leg stump! Length ball, that has spun a decent way across from outside off, and he pre-meditates this. Looking to scoop it over the keeper, but misses out on contact. Just reward for Warrican, who has bowled pretty well in this second innings
flatter, and he goes back to play this towards square leg
length, and he stretches forward to defend one outside off

gets two for the over! A flat ball, and delivered from wide of the crease. Mehidy goes back to cut it away, but it goes off the inside of the bat, down to ground, and then grazes the leg stump along the way
fullish, swings back into him, and he presses forward to defend
length, down the pads, and he works it away towards deep square leg. Long leg has a long way to come across to cut this off, but does well to just get his left hand to it. Two taken
fullish, around off, and he drives it back to the bowler, to his right
back of a length, defended as it angles across him

fuller, on the pads, and he works this away through the square leg region. There's a fielder there, but it evades him to his left. Just dropping short of the fielder there, but a parry allows them to take two
this time he has placed this past square leg. Worked well, with the wrists, to pick up the first boundary of this innings
goes back to defend away on the on side
length, and he goes back to punch towards short midwicket
sharp turn, but starts from around off, and moves well beyond leg. He goes back and lets it pass
tossed up a bit, shorter in length, but he is happy to go back and defend
length, and he goes a touch forward this time to defend
length, goes back to defend. Fielded at short leg
fullish, but wide outside off. Steered away towards gully
back of a length, straight in line, and he defends after getting behind the line of this
length, wide of off, and he stretches forward to defend
wide of the crease, slants across him, and he plays a beautiful extra cover drive. All wrists and bottom hand. Good chase from cover-point, and Shadman Islam is able to reel it back in
length, pitching around leg, and he shuffles across to defend towards square leg
slower ball, thrown a bit wide, and Brathwaite has a waft at it. Misses out on contact
length, and he goes back to defend this
goes back and across and defends a length ball around off, spinning back into him
length, defends with a forward press
fired in a touch quicker, and he goes back to defend
length, down the leg side, ignored
length, around off, and he defends. Did keep a bit low, skidding through, but the turn is still quite slow
cutter, around off, and he punches this straight towards the man moved to the deep
looks for the fuller ball, but outside off, and he shuffles across to defend
length, strays down the pads, and allows him to work this away towards deep square leg
length, and he presses forward to defend

edged, but that hasn't carried to second slip! Length ball, slants into him, and he looks to defend. Runs off the edge, and just eludes Shadman Islam, who gets his fingertips after the ball bounces just ahead of him
length, slower ball again, angling across Brathwaite, who leaves it alone
length, defends with a forward press
crunches this through covers! Fuller, and there's not much turn on offer, and he lazily leans into this to put it away
length, presses forward to whip this away towards square leg
fired in a touch quicker, and he goes back to defend this
defends with a forward press
length, and he defends with a forward press
fullish, outside off, left alone
length, and straightens after pitching around middle. Brathwaite gets squared up a touch, but is able to defend with the bat
length, around off, and he stretches forward to meet it with a dead bat
just a bit shorter in length, and he defends a delivery in the channel outside off, driving it towards point

ouch, painful for Brathwaite! Length, around off, cutting away, and he jams down on that with a defensive prod. Goes on to the inside of his foot, and Brathwaite immediately lets out a yelp. Bounced straight on his toe
fullish, and he defends with a little forward stretch
length ball around off, punched towards mid-on for one
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
flatter and quicker, 88.5kph. Blocked on the front foot
fuller around off, lunges forward and dead-bats it again
too full on the stumps, blocked again

some turn from a length just around off stump, Brathwaite comes forward to defend and is beaten. A half-appeal, and wow, Bangladesh have gone for a review. Not sure if there was any bat involved, and UltraEdge just confirms that. A review lost
length ball around off, defended
turn and bounce from outside off, Campbell comes forward to defend and gets beaten
fuller on the stumps, whipped but cannot beat mid-on
length ball, just outside off, this one hardly turns as Campbell shoulders arms
fuller on the stumps, goes low and sweeps it fine, all along the ground to fine leg boundary
fuller outside off and this time swept hard, to the deep square leg boundary for another four
fuller outside off, pushed towards extra cover from the front foot
looks to come down the track but gets too close to the ball. Pushed towards the bowler
fuller around off, nudges it towards short midwicket
pitched up again, worked towards short midwicket
length ball on middle and leg, defended on the leg side
fuller and wider outside off, goes for the drive but mistimes it to mid-off
another sweep and another boundary. There was a deep square leg in place this time but he hit him well to the right of that fielder, leaving him no chance of cutting it off
length ball outside off, left alone
fuller and dipping on the batsman, worked against the turn to the left of mid-on
fuller on the stumps, stays back and works it towards short fine leg for a quick single
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it right under his eyes
length ball outside off, punches it towards cover from the back foot
fuller on the stumps, defended

fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on
fuller on the off stump this time, pushed towards mid-off
pitched up to the batsman, on middle and leg. Blocked
length ball on the pads, comes forward and turns it towards fine leg. A bit of excitement among the fielders around the bat as Brathwaite played it in front of his pad

a huge appeal for lbw but given not out. Was a length ball outside off and Campbell once again went for the sweep. This time he missed and was hit on the pad but the impact perhaps was outside off. Replays show the impact was umpire's call
fuller on the off, pushed towards mid-on
worked to the left of mid-on from back foot for a single
length ball at the stumps, worked towards short midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and blocks it
plays back to this length ball, kept a wee bit low, tucked away towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on

fuller on the stumps, defended back towards the bowler
flatter and quicker, 90kph, stays back and just defends
similar line and length, some turn here as well, defended again from the back foot
pitched up on the stumps, comes forward and pushes it on the leg side

length ball on the stumps, comes forward and works it on the leg side
fuller around off and middle, defended on the leg side
length ball spinning on to the pads, flicked towards backward square leg
length ball spinning in to cramp Brathwaite as he looks to cut it away
fuller around off, pushed back towards the bowler

length ball spinning on the pads, turned towards square leg
fuller around off, stays back and jabs at it
length ball on the stumps, blocked
fuller on the stumps, defended back this time
