given lbw but Campbell review straightaway. I guess there might have been some bat involved as he look to sweep this delivery from outside off. Whoa! There is nothing on the UltraEdge, the impact just within the line of the off stump, it's umpire's call, and it would have gone on to hit the off stump. Campbell has to walk back as Miraz picks up his fifth wicket of the match
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
a tentative push to a length ball, gets an inside edge on to the pads and the ball rolls towards square leg
down the track and smashes it over midwicket, using his feet just like the first innings to find a boundary

length ball outside off, defended on the off side

fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
slower this time, just outside off, pushed towards short midwicket
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and drives it down the ground, bisecting mid-off and mid-on and find the straight boundary
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, lunges forward and pushes it towards short midwicket

tossed up around off, Brathwaite comes forward and is guilty of defending it with hard hands. Gets an inside edge on to the pads and the ball goes to the right of short leg. Yasir Ali, the substitute, puts in a dive and pouches it one-handed. Miraz has his second, and a big wicket that
uses his feet and works it towards short midwicket
fuller on the stumps, driven down the wicket

beats the outside edge with turn and bounce. A vociferous appeal from the first slip, Shanto I think, but no one else is really sure. They ponder taking a review before deciding against it. UltraEdge shows there was no bat involved
fuller outside off and driven through covers, they collect two to bring up the team's fifty
length ball around off, defended from the back foot
length outside off, stays back and slices it towards backward point
turn and bounce after it comes in with the arm and beats the bat as the batsman looks to defend
an outside edge goes past first slip. Was a length ball around off, Moseley came forward to defend. Only if there were a second slip
length ball around off and middle, defended
pitched up, defended by Moseley
lunges forward and blocks again
fuller and wider, comes forward and drives it to the right of mid-on
tossed up on the stumps, not to the pitch of the ball but goes for the flick. Wasn't in control but away from any of the fielders on the leg side
comes forward and works it towards short midwicket this time
fuller outside off, pushes towards extra cover
length ball at the stumps, defended
length ball on the stumps, looks to defend. Gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on
length ball around off, stays back and defends

length outside off, spinning away. Goes back and cuts it through point for four
length ball around off, goes back and flicks it towards short midwicket
length ball outside off, whipped towards short midwicket from the back foot
length ball spinning in sharply, stays back and works it on the leg side
length ball around off, goes for the pull this time but fails to beat square leg
length ball outside off, punches it towards extra cover
fuller outside off, lunges forward to block, gets beaten but the impact is well outside off
fullish, along leg side, and he eases this to the left of mid-on
length, a bit slower, and he goes back to defend one turning back in from outside off
length, goes back to defend. Under-edge, and rolls towards off stump, but he gets back to watch it bounce away
length, straighter in line, and he gets behind it to defend
turns from outside off, and he goes back to defend
length, worked with the turn towards short midwicket
length, presses forward to defend

keeps low, and traps him in front! Goes back to one that comes to him from around the wicket, and he shapes to flick it away. Goes low, and below the under edge of his bat, and strikes him as he shuffles across. Perhaps would have been worth a review, but Moseley doesn't bother. I think the impact would have been umpire's call, at best. Nope, the replays suggest impact was in line as well
driven off the back foot towards cover
hangs back and punches this towards cover. Goes to the left of the fielder, and they can pick up a single
length, goes back to defend
length, defends from the crease after covering the line
length, presses forward to defend
goes back to punch this towards cover
flat, and he goes back to punch this through the mid-wicket region. No fielder there, so it was a safe swipe across the line, especially once Nayeem dropped it a tad short
length, and he goes back to drive this through the backward point region
length, outside off, and padded away with a forward press
length, driven against the turn towards mid-off
fullish, driven towards cover for a quick single
length, pitching around off and turning back in sharply. He plays it with bat hidden beside the pad. Runs off the pad towards leg gully, and Liton Das collects it
length, played with the turn towards short midwicket
length, presses forward to defend one outside off
length, goes back and cuts this away through backward point
fuller, driven down to long-on
length, sharp turn back into him from around off, and he goes back to defend

sharp turn, from outside off, played with the inner part of the bat, towards short fine leg
full, driven towards deep mid-on with a lot of power
length, goes back to defend
length, defends off the back foot
tossed up, around off, and he takes the invitation to drive. Opens his stance out a touch, and goes inside out but along the ground. Top shot!
length, outside off, left alone
driven to wide cover
defends with a forward press
driven towards cover
uppish drive, towards cover, but falls to the left of Tamim Iqbal at that position. Good bowling, because he drew him forward with each progressive delivery after having overpitched early in the over
awful ball! Very short, and Bonner moved across to try and pull it away, but it snuck under his bat, and to the keeper
driven, a bit uppishly, but to the left of mid-off
turns away from him after pitching around off. Good ball, and well played by Mayers, who didn't go chasing after it
drives this towards cover
fired in a touch quicker. Turns from around leg and middle, and he does well to go back and block
just a tad short, and he goes back to cut this through the cover-point region. Well done by Mayers. Patient with the good balls, and puts away the loose one that follows
length, worked with the turn towards square leg
tossed up, around off, and he defends with a little forward press
length, sharp turn down leg side as he shapes to defend
length, goes back to defend. It keeps low, but he has defended well
length, defends with a forward press
skips down the wicket, to defend one with the turn
length, around leg and middle, and defended pressing forward
length, presses forward to block it
uppish, but beyond short cover, and through for four. Mayers showed in the first innings that he's very strong on the drive, and that continues here
length, turns across from outside off, and he leaves
leaves one outside off, turning further away
length, and he hangs back to guided this past point. Beautiful shot from Mayers
tossed up, off the inside edge, but through towards short fine leg
tossed up, driven beyond cover
full, driven towards long-on
length, guided past slip towrads third man

goes for the big hoick down the ground, and Mustafizur runs back from mid-off, but cannot hold on! It was swirling for a while, and he had to run back and try and take this over his shoulder. Got his fingertips, but ends up dropping it. Has to then chase it to the boundary, as a result of a ricochet off his fingers. To add insult to injury, he has just flicked it back after it touched the rope
defends with a forward press
defends with a forward press
goes back to pat it back towards the bowler
quicker, straighter, and he goes back. Does well to defend with the turn across him
length, and he presses forward to defend
length, fired in a touch quicker, and he opens his stance up, going back, and defends it
fullish, and driven towards cover
length, plays it with a forward press
short, and he goes back to drive this hard, through extra cover. 100 comes up for West Indies
fuller, around leg and middle, and he defends
goes back and cuts hard, but cannot beat point
teasing length, outside off, and he looks to drive. Just checks it a bit, and it goes somewhat in the air to begin with. Drops well short of cover, though
length, driven back to the bowler
length, and he goes back to defend this
fires this in, straighter, and Bonner goes back to defend this
length, stretches forward to defend
full, and he defends with a forward press
length, and he presses forward to defend

length, some bounce away from the batsman, and beats the outside edge. Tough take for Liton, who sees this fly over his right shoulder. Slip gets across to it after running back behind himself, and they pinch a bye
length, played with the turn towards square leg
length, presses forward to defend
length, defended with a little forward press
tossed up, driven towards wide cover
presses forward to defend one around off
cut away towards deep point
length, and he goes back to drive it back to the bowler
flatter, but down the leg side, and he's able to get some pad on this in trying to swat it away. Through towards fine leg, and fetches two
floats this around off, and he goes back to defend
length, driven towards wide cover
sharp turn, from outside off, and he plays back. Spins beyond his inside edge
length, defends with a forward press. Carries to short leg on the bounce
length, and he works it off his pads with the turn. Great reflexes by Yasir Al, at short leg, who wants to then have a shy at the stumps, but he cannot gather the ball completely
worked with the turn towards fine leg

fuller outside off, flicks it towards short midwicket
length around off, punched towards long-on from the back foot
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards covers but no run
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks. Still on 149
and that's his 150. A length ball on the stumps, keeps coming in with the angle. Goes deep and just manages to work it towards short midwicket
length ball outside off, waits for it and steers it past the slip fielder, deftly done
length ball on the pads, goes for the flick but misses and is hit on the pads
length outside off, punched towards sweeper cover off the back foot
an appeal for lbw but not out. Was a length ball on the stumps, Da Silva came forward to defend but is beaten. Was going down though
length ball on the stumps, turns it towards short leg
length ball around off, defended back towards the bowler

a quick single after a bit of hesitation. Was a length ball around off, Mayers looked to defend on the off side. Was in the air for a while before he decides to go for the single. The fielder goes for the direct hit but ends up pinging Shanto at extra cover
length ball at the stumps, defended
length again, punched back towards the bowler
length around off, keeps a touch low. Da Silva is watchful, goes low and blocks
fuller around off, flicked towards short midwicket
length around off, defended
length, around off, turns across him, and he goes back to defend
presses forward to defend one, fired in at 86.5 kph
fullish, and he looks to paddle this away. Drops off the bottom of the bat
just a bit short in length, and he cuts this fiercely. A bit aerial, but zips past slip, and also gives short third man no chance!
length, driven to cover, and they take on Mominul Haque's arm. He has to move across to his right, gather and then throw. It would still have been gone, had he got a direct hit!
short, down the pads, and he goes back to whip this away. Mushfiqur Rahim goes charging from fine leg, and seems to have pulled this back from the fence
flighted around off, and he opens his stance up. Ends up driving it straight back towards the bowler
cut away towards point
fuller, and he goes back to defend

down the wicket, and over the top of long-on. There's a man there, but he's just a witness to it. Did supremely well to get to the pitch of the ball, and from there on, there was just one outcome likely
drops it a bit short, and he can rock back and drive to sweeper cover
length, comes back into him, and he defends as it turns from outside off
length, goes back to punch it towards long-on
length, and he goes back to punch this to point
length, worked away against the turn towards deep midwicket
length, and he clatters this down the ground. Long off and long on have come together in an attempt to stop it, and the ball has slipped between them
goes back and defends one towards midwicket

off the edge, but perhaps just short of Yasir Ali, the substitute at slip. Length ball, that he wanted to run down deliberately towards third man. I think it just fell short of the fielder, to his left. A good stop, in the end
fullish, driven towards long on
wide of the crease, and he skips down the wicket. Smashes this straight over the top. Long off can just watch this sail over his head
length, and he goes back to punch this towards deep midwicket. Settles for one
length, worked with the turn, past Miraz, towards long-on
takes this on the full with a forward press, and drives it past the bowler to long-off
length, goes back to defend
fuller length, slower ball, and driven towards long on. I think he was looking to go straighter, but was beaten by the change in pace
it's the cutter, and he takes his bottom hand off as it flies off the edge. Past the slip, and through to third man
length, and he has gone across the line, and absolutely nailed it! Possibly a change in pace again, and he latches on to this, and slaps this way over midwicket
cutter, from outside off, and he guides this down towards deep backward point
fullish, but wide of off, and he can guide this through the vacant point region
fullish, and driven towards cover
length, cuts back in from outside off, and he can go back to defend
goes back to ease this with the turn towards midwicket. Single pinched

goes for a big swing, to a ball outside off, and Liton whips the bails off. Referred, but he looks safe. The back foot did sneak out for a bit, but then the ball bounced a fair amount. And he had enough time to sneak the foot back in
goes back to drive this towards deep point
length, punched towards mid-on. Some hesitation, as Shanto gets across from short midwicket to cut this off. Mayers had taken a few steps down the pitch, but made his ground after that
defends with a forward press
short in length, and he can go back and swat this towards deep cover. The sweeper comes by from deep point
flatter, and he goes back to drive this. Off the inner part of his bat, towards short midwicket
defends one after getting behind the line
length, goes back and glides this towards square leg
length, fired in a touch quicker, turns across from outside off, and he defends
full, and driven to short midwicket
fullish, and he drives this with a forward press towards short midwicket
presses forward to block one around off
presses this towards short midwicket
sweeps from outside off, but cannot beat a man at short fine leg
length, goes back to punch this with the turn. Cannot beat square leg
length, driven against the turn, and gets it away towards extra cover. Should fetch him two. Sensible to allow Mayers to stay on strike
full, and he goes over cow corner. Not a great idea to be pitching it up like this, to be honest
punches this off the back foot, towards short midwicket
flat, and he can go back and push this towards deep midwicket. Stays at 199
presses forward to defend one around off
length, and he goes back to defend one that was fired in a touch quicker
Da Silva chances his arm, and gets it over deep mid-on. Fuller in length, and he presses forward to get close to the ball, and then whips it with a lot of bottom hand, towards long-on
length, driven towards wide cover
tossed up, firmly struck, but straight to wide cover
runs this off the edge, past first slip, but short third man is quick to get to the ball
length, zips across the outside edge, and he is beaten
fuller, around leg and middle, punted back to the bowler

length, goes back and punches this to deep backward point to bring up his 200! Takes his helmet off, and punches the air. Has the look of a man who is exhausted but just so in the zone at the same time. First man to have scored 200 in the 4th innings on debut in Test cricket
length, and he has swung this over deep midwicket. They are just one boundary hit away now
length, worked off his hips towards deep backward square leg

that's gone through him! Da Silva stretches forward to defend, but this doesn't turn. Goes on with the arm from around off, and goes through the gap between bat and pad. West Indies had lost five for six in the first innings, but you get the impression they are better placed this time to see it home!
presses forward to defend
defends with a forward press. Off the edge, along the ground, to slip
presses forward to defend
length and punches this towards deep point
length, and he presses forward to defend
length, angles across from off to leg
goes back to defend one, pitching around middle
length, and he allows this to spin across and strike his thigh
defended after shuffling across to cover the line
fullish, driven inside out towards deep cover

fullish length, he looks to defend. It goes off pad towards forward short leg, but Bangladesh take the review anyway. It's a quickish delivery, and seems to have beaten him for turn and bounce. No nudge on this. Stays not out, as it also would have comfortably missed the leg stump
fuller, straighter, and defended towards short midwicket
tossed up, and he presses forward to block this
length ball, and he presses forward. Off the inside edge, and through to leg slip. Given out, and he is happy to walk
defended towards short midwicket
goes back to punch this, but cannot beat cover
driven to cover, off the back foot
played towards mid-on, and they pinch a quick single, and that's the win for West Indies!
